author: {'steamid': '76561198025571064', 'num_games_owned': 2180, 'num_reviews': 1520, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1709331149}
review:
Laser Disco Defenders – рогалик. Обычно у рогаликов очень простой геймплей в освоении, тут же всё неприлично просто. Идёте из точки а в точку б, уничтожаете всех врагов, открываете портал. Главная сложность, наплодить лучей из бластера, которые отражаются от поверхностей и уничтожают всё на своём пути. Постепенно открываются новые шмотки для героев.

Стилистика в стиле диско, и вроде бы выглядит неплохо, но что-то где-то недостаёт. А потом запускается уровень. Просто дыра с простеньким фоном, просто противники, на этом всё. И получается такой контраст: яркий диско – бедный космос. Музыка, которая является краеугольным камнем всего лишь музыка, саундтрек просто нормальный.

Проходите мимо, осторожно купленные отзывы.

author: {'steamid': '76561199010042150', 'num_games_owned': 3874, 'num_reviews': 2454, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1681349694}
review:
I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right hand—the hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bed—the hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 ♥♥♥♥ minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561199027017512', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 2061, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1680, 'last_played': 1634670772}
review:
Tras unas 28 horas de juego e incontables partidas y, por tanto, muertes, he de decir para esta reseña que, a pesar de no haber superado (aún) una partida completa, este juego engancha. Frustra como si estuviese programado para hacerlo, pero es quien juega quien se pone en peligro en realidad. Cada vez que disparamos, cada vez que no usamos un power-up, cada vez que cambiamos de personaje o equipo. Pero que sí, que CADA vez que disparamos. Ese láser da vueltas por el mapa incansable e inexorable, rebotando de forma cada vez más aleatoria. Y no ayuda que haya cada vez más enemigos y trampas, ni que los niveles sean aleatorios y cada vez más extensos. No ayuda para sobrevivir, pero sí para divertirse y frustrarse. Diría que a partes iguales pero, tras tanto tiempo jugando, afirmaría que es más divertido que frustrante, aunque recomiendo sesiones de juego cortas. Fastidia mucho morir a menudo por tus propios disparos, la verdad.
Sufrid y disfrutad. ¿En qué orden? Eso es cosa vuestra.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021422660', 'num_games_owned': 3620, 'num_reviews': 1228, 'playtime_forever': 445, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1580098595}
review:
[h1] Радует, что в этой якобы диско-игре можно убрать под 0 дрожание экрана и хотя бы не бояться словить припадок... [/h1]

А сама суть игры как в роуг-лайках - выбираем героя и пошли бороздить уровни с выносом врагов, попутно пытаясь не откинуть копыта самому. Из врагов по традиции иногда выпадают какие-то бонусы вроде замедления времени или увеличения жизни. Смерть тут заставляет начинать сначала, но и добавляет какой-то опыт в зависимости от прогресса прохождения. Да, забыл ещё сказать, что лазеры здесь постоянны. То есть они при пуске так и летают по всему уровню без исчезновения. Это касается как лазерных лучей из своего оружия, так и вражеские лучи. Вот в этом психоделии потом и приходится лавировать...

Русского перевода в игре нет и в начале есть некий момент ступора в попытке понять происходящее. Но потом становится ясен принцип игры и становится всё довольно прозаично...

Персонажей также можно видоизменять. А достижения здесь редкие. Похоже, что многие купили эту игру, но так и забросили... Даже первое достижение есть у менее 10% игроков.

Облачного сохранения здесь тоже нет. Зато хоть карточки завезли с достижения и какой-то поддержкой контроллера. Но лучше играть с клавомыши. На контроллере целиться тяжелее...

А играть можно тем, у кого совсем уж острая ностальгия по эпохе диско и всех атрибутах. Притом графически игра так себе. И можно только мелодии назвать более-менее соответствующими духу. А остальное слабовато..

author: {'steamid': '76561197972584572', 'num_games_owned': 1637, 'num_reviews': 386, 'playtime_forever': 138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1579234377}
review:
#Beaten - Played (Im guessing) at least 40 hours on PS4/Vita

A very fun twin stick rogue-like where the main twist is you (and your enemies) shoot lasers, all of which endlessly bounce off walls, making for things to dodge which trying to clear (all enemies in) a level. 14 levels total.  You can beat it in around 15 minutes. It took me 40+ hours to beat it once. It feels extremely fair. It's just hard.

Also endless mode!

An easy recommendation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121398682', 'num_games_owned': 19753, 'num_reviews': 1577, 'playtime_forever': 202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1674939144}
review:

review:
Pros:
-Good music
-Orignal mechanics
-Asthetically pleasing
-Well priced
-Decent powerups
-Addicting
-Endless mode! (replayable)

Neutrals: (mostly facts)
-not enough enemies (a good possibility is that I have not got far enough)
-bullet hell
-brightly colored
-groovy

Cons:
-No sensitivity option that I could find (sensitivity i think was pulled straight from my mouse so it was fine!)
-no graphics options (however the game runs fine on my PC... then again I have a GTX1070, 16 gigs of ram and an I5 6600k..)
-i died and i almost broke my headset.
-camera angle is RARELY off

author: {'steamid': '76561197966527290', 'num_games_owned': 3794, 'num_reviews': 473, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1489213282}
review:
En quelques images, ce jeu de Out of Bounds ressemble à s’y méprendre à un énième Twin-Stick Shooter. En vérité s’en est bien un, mais il a une particularité : tous les projectiles laser que vous tirez rebondissent sur les bords des niveaux, des grottes que vous devez explorer, jusqu’à peut-être risquer de vous toucher. Il vous faut donc viser proprement, sans trop en abuser, sous peine de vite être son propre pire ennemi.

Malheureusement, Laser Disco Defenders a beau être pavé de bonnes intentions et posséder un principe de base intéressant, il est aussi extrêmement court. On en voit vite le bout et ce ne sont pas les quelques objets à débloquer au fil des parties, transformant votre façon de jouer avec le personnage choisi, qui changeront vraiment la donne. Une fois la fin du jeu visionnée, l’envie d’y revenir n’est rapidement plus là. Quel dommage !

author: {'steamid': '76561198294650501', 'num_games_owned': 385, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1498311996}

author: {'steamid': '76561198074672646', 'num_games_owned': 6653, 'num_reviews': 596, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1476855536}
review:
[h1]Laser Disco Defenders, les gardiens de l’Univers[/h1]

Un super méchant veut imposer sa musique (surement du rap ou une autre s******** du même genre) à toute la Terre.

Des super-héros, super-gentils aimant de la bonne musique (le disco, entre autres) vont venir nous aider à combattre le super méchant, ce sont les Laser Disco Defenders.

C’est un twin stick shooter (gestion séparée du déplacement du personnage et de son tir en même temps) avec des éléments de bullet hell (une tonne de tirs ennemis rendant difficile l’esquive et la réplique).

Ce qui est appréciable dans ce jeu, c’est d’avoir mis des personnages comme héros au lieu des vaisseaux habituels. Son originalité est donc son point fort.

[url=www.graal.fr/2016/10/20/test-laser-disco-defenders-la-version-pour-steam/]Pour découvrir l’intégralité de mon test sur Laser Disco Defenders.[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198022880360', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1051, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 284, 'last_played': 1669895749}
review:
Great game - colourful and fun retro-laser shootout. Nice and difficult, too - yet as the levels are procedurally generated you don't get bored!

LDD's most unique dynamic is that your shots (and enemy shots) never dissappear and stay lethally bouncing around the game so you end up spending a lot of time dodging your own laser beams... it lends itsself to a lot of interesting strategies - do you just fire off a couple and be patient and wait for them to blast the enemy (boring) or do you go in guns blazing and get out before you can be hit by the ricochets? It's up to you!

author: {'steamid': '76561198034072369', 'num_games_owned': 13581, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 500, 'last_played': 1481766857}
review:
[h1] Laser Disco Defenders [/h1]

DISCLAIMER: I received this product for no cost for the purpose of reviewing. However, this does not affect my views and opinions of the game.

Laser Disco Defenders is a 2D twin-stick shooter with bullet-hell elements. You play as one of many "disco defenders", each with their own benefits and disadvantages. You navigate your defender through each stage destroying all of the enemies in order to progress to the next area. You have to dodge enemy fire, as well as your OWN shots which is where a lot of the skill comes into play. 

--------

[b] Graphics: 7 / 10 [/b] 

The game is very stylish. It has this sort of cartoon-y disco space-like aesthetic, and it looks really nice. The game has a lot of flashy lighting effects though you are able to differentiate the "laser beams" from the other objects and background effects of the game. This is really important as you need to keep track of where everything is in order to dodge beams, and fire off your own shots correctly. Although the game is very funky, I do feel that sometimes the enemies and stages don't always match the overall theme of the game, which is supposed to be this disco motif. The title should run fine on any low to mid tier graphics card and CPU, though I don't know how the game's performance is affected if hundreds of lasers are flying around on the stage. 

--------

[b] Sound: 7 / 10 [/b] 

The game's OST is quite groovy, which is to be expected from a game involving disco. The soundtrack goes along with the theme of the game very well, and the sound assets are decent. The laser shots and environmental hazards all have very generic sounds though they get the job done. 

--------

[b] Mechanics: 6 / 10 [/b] 

The mechanics are very straightforward. You guide your character through each stages using your keyboard keys, aim with the mouse, and fire off a laser with the click of a button. You have to destroy all the enemies within each stage in order to open a portal that sends you off to another location. The levels will get progressively more difficult, and there are a good amount of different enemies and environmental hazards you must look out for. 

There is no ammo or limit to the amount of lasers you can fire off, though there are consequences to shooting off too many. Your lasers will not disappear. They bounce off walls and objects until they hit your enemies or your character. The more shots you fire, the more lasers you have to dodge. This is where a lot of skill comes into play as you can angle your shots well enough so that they bounce towards your enemy, and for shots that start hitting the walls, your dodging skills will be tested. 

There are various power-ups within the game that; change your firing speed, give you spreading shots, and change your type of shot. Each character has their own stat line, and you can choose which character better suits your play style. Some are faster than others while having only one hit-point, and others can be really slow but also very tank-y.  Knowing which character your play-style is more comfortable with can determine how well you progress through the game.

--------

[b] Final Personal Remarks: [/b]

The game is a very solid piece of work and I enjoyed the soundtrack a lot. I'm not very good at bullet-hell style games and this one really isn't any exception. Knowing when to save your bullets so as to not flood your screen is important, though at the same time spamming them makes it easier to destroy your enemies. I found it hard to balance that concept, though it's because I'm not very good at that sort of thing. 

Thanks to the Devs for giving me the opportunity to review the game, as well as anyone who took this review into consideration, I hope it helped.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003030375', 'num_games_owned': 3129, 'num_reviews': 773, 'playtime_forever': 357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 357, 'last_played': 1477775430}
review:
Laser Disco Defenders:
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
 
Lord Monotone, a self-pronounced musical genius is somewhat peeved that his masterpiece, a 10- hour space sax solo, was unequivocally rejected by the Intergalactic Vision Song Contest. He is now hiding in the Seebach Star System and composing the worst musical solo the Galaxy will ever have to endure. Who can stop Lord Monotone and save the Galaxy? We need to call the big notes - this is definitely a job for the funky Laser Disco Defenders team! 

Laser Disco Defenders is an Action/Twin Stick Shooter where you take control of one of four heroes to defeat the evil Lord Monotone.  

The game starts with a fun cartoon which introduces you to the story and characters, then a small tutorial (one level) to give you the feel of the game. After that, you start playing the Storyline mode. There is an Endless mode but you must beat the game before unlocking it. Anyway, before entering the groovy Disco Fever, you will have to choose your hero . . . will it be Mr Baker (Poney M), Tommy, Donna or Liz? The difficulty will depend of which one you choose. For example, Mr Baker has more health (four hearts) but he only has one shoe which represents how fast he moves. Donna only has two hearts but three shoes, which means she moves faster but dies faster, too. Each of them has three perks, being vision, spacesuit and shoes. You can update these perks by achieving tasks during gameplay. 

This game is absolutely frantic and fun! Here you are in the middle of a these levels shooting your lasers at incoming enemies, destroying bombs, mines and station projectors on the outskirts of the levels which shoots lasers, too. But this is not all - the lasers bounce back as soon as they touch the outskirts of the level. If you are playing Donna and you been hit twice, that’s it - Game Over! 

Occasionally, enemies drops hearts or one of four special abilities and they will be very helpful, let me tell you! My favourite one is the Vortex which, when you activate it, makes the laser beams that surround you disappear.  When all enemies are eliminated, a portal appears and you move to the next level. 
A particularly good point is that all levels are randomly generated, which is challenging but gives the game great re-playability. 

I really like the cartoon graphics and groovy soundtrack. From the controls point of view either mouse/keyboard or gamepad are great. My preference is definitely using the gamepad.

Positives:
~~~~~~~ 

-	Good cartoon graphics
-	Fast, fun and frantic gameplay
-	Levels are randomly generated
-	Great controls
-	Achievements and trading cards

Negatives:
~~~~~~~~ 

-	It is hard and frustration might kick in

9/10

If you like a good challenge, Laser Disco Defenders is right up there. 

Key provided by developer/publisher for review purposes. Any opinions expressed are entirely my own!

author: {'steamid': '76561198050474710', 'num_games_owned': 14788, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1477410847}
review:
В последнее время выходит очень большое кол-во инди проектов, но эта игра не стоит с ними на одной планке... 
Перед вами маленький, но шедевр! Игра выполнена в мультяшном стиле с ненавязчивым, ретмичным музончиком. Очень красочная и энергичная. 
Уровни представляют собой серию комнат соединённых небольшими коридорами со всевозможными препятствиями и ловушками. По мере уничтожения препятствий и лазерных пушек, вам открывается портал на прохождение в следующий уровень и маленькие всевозможные плюшки в виде одёжек, задержек времени, смены оружия. Стоит обратить внимание на используемую в игре силу тяжести и физику в общем. С удовольствием провел в игре пару часов и продолжу играть дальше. На последок скажу, что игра привлекла и мою дочурку и она с удовольствием режется в нее уже 5-ый час ))
Отличная игра! И большое спасибо разработчику за предоставленный ключ для пробной игры и обзора. Побольше бы таких качественных инди проектов. 
Thank's to the developer for kindly providing me with a key for review purposes.
Личная оценка: 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198040884867', 'num_games_owned': 2434, 'num_reviews': 901, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1475859040}
review:
[i]Thank you to the developer for kindly providing me with a key for review purposes.[/i]

---

[b]While there is some room for improvement and more content, [i]Laser Disco Defenders[/i] is a neat little roguelite that brings an interesting twist to the bullet-hell genre.[/b] I found the 'one-more-run' addiction strong in this one. Very easy to get into. There are metagame unlockables in the form of clothes/swag that are functionally different and change how you play the game. Some make it slightly easier, and others just make it more chaotic (risk/reward balance). 

[i]Essentially, this is a bullet-hell schmup where your laser-beams (that either you or enemies shoot) are eternally persistant in the relatively small confines of the level.[/i] They bounce back and forth forever and clog up the area and make it difficult to stay alive. It is a pretty cool idea that works well. The levels are a series of circular rooms connected by hallways. Once you kill everything, a portal spawns allowing you to go to the next floor/level.

Both keyboard and mouse, and controller support is solid. [b]While the artwork and music are fine enough, I don't really understand the theme of 'disco', and I think the game would have faired better as a more serious space shooter - but that's neither-here-nor-there.[/b] Another odd design decision is the use of gravity. Instead of just making this a top-down shooter, your disco dancer is always fighting against gravity which can make it all the more difficult in bullet-hell. [b]Fortunately, while the game is difficult, I never felt rage.[/b] I would not describe this as 'hard-as-nails', and I'm ok with that.

[b]I feel like they have an outstanding core mechanic that is fresh and is definately enough to carry a full game. I also think that the content is a bit light, here.[/b] There are only 9 unlockable clothing/swag items, to my knowledge. They are all worthy of being there (functionally different, etc.), but I'd like to see more. Within about an hour I unlocked 7/9. You unlock these items by completing certain objectives similiar to the 'lists of 3' found in mobile games. This would normally set off alarms for me, but I don't think this title will see mobile markets, but who knows.

[b]Pros:[/b]
+Great core mechanic of persistant lasers.
+Definately a good balance of difficulty and fun, causing the 'one-more-run' addiction to gain those metagame upgrades.
+Controller and keyboard/mouse support both work nicely.

[b]Cons:[/b]
-The theme of the game feels off - and maybe it was something that was decided last minute. The only thing 'disco' would be the character you play, and maybe the music. The enemies and worlds have nothing to do with disco, as far as I can tell. There is one interactable I found that is a disco ball, but thats about it. Seems like an afterthought to me.
-I don't particularly like the gravity variable, and think the game would be much more fun and precise if it were just a top-down shooter a la [i]Starward Rogue[/i] or similiar.
-I'd like to see more unlockables and content, in general. What is present is great, just light.
-I think holding 'shift' should give you a temporary speed boost with some penalty (ie. taking more damage during that boost, or not being able to shoot).

[b]The price point isn't bad, and the core mechanic is neat, but I'd feel much better in the $5-ish range, personally.[/b] This could be remedied easily with more content.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067471293', 'num_games_owned': 171, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1656245678}

author: {'steamid': '76561198005667452', 'num_games_owned': 423, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1477769253}
review:
tl;dr a fast-paced bullet hell with funky tunes and funky moves.

Laser Disco Defenders isn't the sort of game I'd pick up normally, but I had a preview of a pre-release build at a demo booth at a local gaming and video convention and I've followed with interest since.

The gameplay is essentially flying though the level and destroying enemies (with frikkin' lasers), with the interesting twist of any shots stay in the level. There's different characters - they vary from slow with lots of health to very fast with no health, and outfit additions like medallion (protect you from a hit) and in-game powerups (slow down time, suck lasers in), and firing modes (long, slow laser burst, lots of fast laser bursts).

The game basically runs on anything (my system is quite overkill - AMD FX-8320E 8-Core, 16GB, 480GB SSD and RX480 8GB) - the only things I'd like to see in future updates are a passcode system or the ability to skip to later levels once they've been played once (at the cost of a point handicap, or something similar) and maybe split-screen multiplayer. One on keyboard + Mouse, one on controller, or both players on controller. Could be intersting.

Endless replayability, a funky soundtrack, and a combination of being both infuriating and "just one more go" for under £7.
